body:
Added tests.  This is basically a continuation of [5d655aabcb47a68e7ce1dfb60222e951a6d30169].  That commit added the ability to perform mass assignments on nested models, and this commit provides a patch to ensure that you can enable that through accepts_nested_attributes_for instead of directly hitting #{association}_attributes= with :without_protection => true.

See the following in the aforementioned commit.

    def unassignable_keys(assignment_opts)
      assignment_opts[:without_protection] ? UNASSIGNABLE_KEYS - %w[id] : UNASSIGNABLE_KEYS
    end

My primary use case is the ability to specify a primary key through mass assignment on the nested association.

Where should I be putting the docs?
